content: Ælfric's translation of parts of Pentateuch and Joshua, letter to Wulfgeat and Libellus de veteri testamento et nouo

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 1r) INCIPIT PREFATIO GENESIS ANGLICE | [Æ]LFRIC MUNUC GRET ÆÐELWÆRD EALDORMANN EAD[MOD]|lice.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 3r) INCIPIT LIBER GENESIS ANGLICE | 'ON ANGINNE GESCEOP GOD HEOFENAN AND EORÐAN.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 37r) ellesmoth on hebrisc. exodus on grecisc. exit[us] | on lyden. utfæreld on englisc. | ÞYS SYND ISRAELA BEARNA NAMAN ÐE MID IACOBE || foron on egipta land hig foron ealle mid hira hiwun.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 65v) Her onginneð seo þridde boc. þe is genemned. on ebreisc uaiecra. 7 leviticus.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 72r) Her onginð seo boc þe ys genemned on | ebreisc. uagedaber þ[æ]t ys on lyden numerus. | 7 on englisc getel.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 82v) Her onginð seo boc þe ys genemned on ebreisc. | helleadabarim 7 on grecisc. deut[e]ronomiu[m]. 7 on | lyden secunda lex. 7 on english. seo æftre æ.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 98v) INCIPIT LIBER IOSVE. 'Hit wæs geworden æfter moyses forðsiþe. drihten spræc to iosue | nunes suna

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 108r) DE LIBRO IUDICUM ANGLICE. | ÆFTER ÐAM ÐE MOYSES SE MÆRA HERETOGA þæt | godes folc gelædde of pharanones þeowetter ofer | ða readan sæ

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 115v) Nis þis gewrit be anu[m] | men awriten ac ys be eallum.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 120v) Incipit libellus de u 'e' teri testamento et nouo. | Ðis gewrit wæs to anu[m] men gediht ac hit mæg swa ðeah | manegum fremian.

objectDesc.extent:
211 mm x 138 mm (dimensions of all - size of leaves).
155 mm x 90 mm (dimensions of all - size of written space).

handDesc.summary: Mainly in one hand. A second hand wrote fol. 15/8-21 and fol. 15v/1-10 and a third wrote fol. 17/11-23.

hands.name: main text
hands.description: Fols 1-141, except fols 15r/8-21, 15v/1-10 and 17r/11-23. A small and regular rounded hand. wo

characters.note: s low or long s used. The long s is used initially and medial, and has a broken shaft made in two strokes. The descender curves to the left.
ð has a long upstroke tagged to the left at the top, the cross-stroke not transecting the upstroke.
d: a small round back with a short tapered ascender curved to the right.

hands.name: additions
hands.description: Fols 15r/8-21, 15v/1-10. Another small and regular rounded hand, very similar to the main hand.

characters.note: s short or long s used. The long s is used initially and medially, and the descender curves to the left. Short s with a hook-like ascender, stopping on the writing line.
ð has a long upstroke occasionally tagged to the left at the top, occasionally it curves to the right.
d: a small round back with a short tappered ascender curved to the right.
descenders curving to the left with a serif.

hands.name: additions
hands.description: Fol. 17r/11-23. A fairly large rounded hand.

characters.note: ð has a long upstroke tapered and curved to the right at the top.
d: a small round back with a short ascender curved to the left.
Long s with a flat foot.
Tapered descenders, which turn to the left.

binding: Leather binding of s. xvii1 bearing Laud's arms. The front and back covers have become detached (Doane 2002, p. 74). Graham suggests that the fragments of pasteboard stuck to the verso of fol. iv indicate that it served as a pastedown in the Cottonian binding. He argues that L'Isle removed Cotton's binding and had it rebound, retaining the Cottonian endleaves but turning them over and around in the process (2000, p. 293).

history.provenance: In the 1542 catalogue of the old Royal Library, it was number 159 (fol. 2, top), and it is described as 'the pentatuik and saints Lyues'. It belonged later to Cotton (see Ker 1938, p. 132). Cotton 'lent the part now at Oxford, ''Liber Genesis et pentatuchum Saxonice' bound withe my arms and clapses in 4to' to 'Mr. Lyll of Cambrig' before 23rd of April 1621, as appears from the list of Cotton's loan of books in MS. Harley 6018, fol. 148v' (Ker 1957, p. 424).
history.acquisition: Kere notes: 'The dates of ownership and gift suggest that Laud obtained the manuscript from L'Isle (cf. Laud misc. 201, 381, 636). Former Bodleian pressmark Laud E. 19' (Ker 1957, p. 424).

admin: Manuscript described by Orietta Da Rold with the assistance of Hollie Morgan (2010) and Owen Roberson (2012).
